item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:13, topic:524552”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=643102.msg4331726#msg4331726 date=1373743007]

Thanks guys. Atomic, you got me what I was looking for.
I shouldn’t be, yes, but I have to be. I have no idea wtf I’m doing to be perfectly honest. How long did it take you guys to get just the plain basics down?

Edit: Example would be, I need to find:

The sum of all multiples of 3 and 5 under 1000. Tricky sticky shit for micky.

Not really understanding, try explaining better.

public static int getSumOfMultiples(int maximumRange, int... multiplesOf) { int sum = 0; for (int multipleOf : multiplesOf) { if (maximumRange % multipleOf == 0) { sum += maximumRange / multipleOf; } } return sum; }
[/quote]

[quote]
"If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below 1000."[/quote][/quote]

public static int getSumOfMultiples(int maximumRange, int... multiplesOf) { int sum = 0; for (int i = 0; i < maximumRange; i++) { for (int multipleOf : multiplesOf) { if (i % multipleOf == 0) { sum += i; } } } return sum; }

public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Sum of multiples: " + getSumOfMultiples(10, 3, 5)); }

Read full topic

item.source: How can I find multiples in java?

item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:15, topic:524552”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=643102.msg4331794#msg4331794 date=1373749539]

for(int i = 1; i < maximumRange; i++) { for(int multiple : multiplesOf) { if(i % multiple == 0) sum += multiple; } }
[/quote]

err not what he’s talking about.

Your test is one, mine is two.

[quote]
Test one: 1994, test two: 233168[/quote]

my solution:

[code=java]
private static int getMultiples(int multiple) {
int sum = 0;

	sum = 999 / multiple;
	sum = sum * (sum + 1) / 2 * multiple;

	return sum;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
	int sum = getMultiples(3) + getMultiples(5) - getMultiples(15);
	System.out.println(sum);
}

[/code][/quote]I posted a solution that used the same concept as yours and then deleted it because I realized that it doesn’t take into account duplicate multiples. In your case there will be a ton of them, seeing as 5 and 15 are multiples of themselves. I’m not sure if that’s the only reason Hco’s gives a different answer, but yours is definitely much larger than it should be.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I find multiples in java?

item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:524552”]for(int i = 1; i < maximumRange; i++) { for(int multiple : multiplesOf) { if(i % multiple == 0) sum += multiple; } }[/quote]

err not what he’s talking about.

Your test is one, mine is two.

Test one: 1994, test two: 233168

my solution:

	private static int getMultiples(int multiple) {
		int sum = 0;

		sum = 999 / multiple;
		sum = sum * (sum + 1) / 2 * multiple;

		return sum;
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		int sum = getMultiples(3) + getMultiples(5) - getMultiples(15);
		System.out.println(sum);
	}

item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:10, topic:524552”][quote author=PI_Developer link=topic=643102.msg4329863#msg4329863 date=1373493521]
Thanks guys. Atomic, you got me what I was looking for.
I shouldn’t be, yes, but I have to be. I have no idea wtf I’m doing to be perfectly honest. How long did it take you guys to get just the plain basics down?

Edit: Example would be, I need to find:

The sum of all multiples of 3 and 5 under 1000. Tricky sticky shit for micky.
[/quote]I’m not sure what you mean, do you mean common multiples, like 15 + 30 + 45, etc in this case?[/quote]

No, he means problem 1 from http://projecteuler.net which is:
"If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below 1000."

I posted the solution in Java above

item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Yeah I know, but you shouldn’t need to be spoon fed

public class Multiples {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		int range = 1000;
		int result = 0;

		for (int i = 1; i < limit; i++) { // runs a loop from 1 to your range
			if (i % 3 == 0 || i % 5 == 0) { // checks if number is multiple of 3 OR 5
				result += i; // if it is, then add to your results
			}
		}

		System.out.println("Result: " + result);
	}

}

Read full topic

item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

PI_Developer:

Not what I’m trying to do, trying to get all of the multiples of two numbers below a certain int & put them in an int themselves.

what…?

int getMultiple(int below, int x, int y) {
    return (x < below) && (y < below) ? y % x : 0;
}

// "put them in an int themselves."

int multiple = getMultiple(...);

This is all I got out of what you said.

edit: or did you mean this?

int getMultiple(int below, int x, int y) {
    return (y % x) < below ? y % x : 0;
}

item.title: How can I find multiples in java?
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[code]
/**

  • Checks if x is a multiple of y
    **/
    boolean isMultipleOf(int x, int y) {
    return y % x == 0; // % divides and returns the remainder. if there is no remainder, then the number is a multiple
    }[/code]
